summary.title: Website Threat Model
summary.description: This Flask blog application provides a web-based User Interface for dedicated/assigned users to register, log in, and manage blog posts. Communication is done through the backend utilizing HTTP/HTTPS APIs and data exchanges, enabling authentication, post creation, and retrieval. Login sessions should enforce authenticated access, while the database stores sensitive information such as user credentials, session details, and blog content. These assets collectively enable the blogâ€™s functionality and represent critical points requiring security protections.

diagrams.title: STRIDE diagram

data.name:
User Interface UI / 

Browser
data.description: The web pages (Jinja2 templates) served to users

threats.title: Generic Spoofing Threats
threats.description: Phishing: Fake login attempts, credential theft, and fake front-ends.
threats.mitigation:
Align mitigation practice with OWASP Top Ten A01, A07, and, if necessary, A07.
Ensure secure session handling and login page integrity.
Educate users on recognizing fake login pages and suspicious links.
Implement anti-phishing protections (e.g., domain validation, email filtering).

threats.title: Generic Repudiation threat
threats.description: Users deny login/logout without proper logging
threats.mitigation: Implement security measures that prevent the manipulation of log data, such as logging all authentication events with timestamps, user IDs, IP addresses, and session IDs.

data.name:
Login Session
Manager
data.description: Exchange of login credentials, Handles authentication, session tokens/cookies, and user identity

threats.title: Generic Repudiation threat
threats.description: Users deny login/logout without proper logging.

data.name: Database Server
data.description: Persistent storage containing users, posts, and comments.

threats.title: Generic Tampering Threat
threats.mitigation:
Enforce the principle of least privilege
Use prepared statements and parameterized queries
Restrict network access database should not be directly accessible from the public internet

data.name: External Apps
data.description: Connecting to any external app if necessary
data.reasonOutOfScope: This is still a testing/development stage

data.name: Data Boundary
data.description: This trust between Data and Webapp exchange.

data.name: SQL Queries
data.description: Request for  reading/writing posts, users, comments.

threats.title: Generic DoS Threat
threats.mitigation: Implement time frame rate limiting, use WAF (web application firewall), and use parameterized queries instead of dynamically building SQL strings from user input.

data.name: Web App Queries Results
data.description: Response to Queries for reading/writing posts, users, comments.

threats.title: Generic Information disclosure Threat
threats.description: Database dump/leak of passwords or posts
threats.mitigation:
Ensure that all user inputs are properly validated and sanitized.
Implement strong authentication processes.

data.name: Session ID Response
data.description: Session validation requests and Logout / token invalidation

data.name: HTTP Response
data.description: Login response / returns HTML or JSON

threats.title: Generic Information Disclosure threat
threats.description: Session Sniffing - leaked session cookies or error messages and transmitting sensitive data (passwords, session IDs) over unencrypted HTTP
threats.mitigation:
Align with OWASP Top 10 mitigation practice A02
Enforce HTTPS Everywhere
Set Secure, HttpOnly, and SameSite attributes on session cookies.

threats.title: Generic Denial of service threat
threats.mitigation:
Implement rate limiting to restrict the number of requests per IP/user per time window.
Use WAF (Web Application Firewall) to detect and block suspicious traffic patterns.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF): A logged-in user is manipulated by an attacker into submitting a malicious form.
threats.mitigation:
Align with OWASP Top 10 mitigation practices for A05 and A01.
Use anti-CSRF tokens in forms and validate them server-side.
Implement Same Site cookies to restrict cross-origin requests.

data.name: Fetch Data Exchange
data.description: External apps fetch data (posts, comments) or send data through APIs.

threats.title: Generic DoS Threat
threats.description: Excessive API requests: An attacker floods an unauthenticated API endpoint (e.g., a search function or login page) with requests.
threats.mitigation:
Align with OWASP Top Ten mitigation practice A09, A04.
Use a rate-limiting library to restrict the number of requests
Use CAPTCHA on sensitive endpoints such as login and search forms, to prevent automated abuse

threats.title: Generic Tampering Threat
threats.description: Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR), where access to another user's data is gained by an attacker manipulating API parameters.
threats.mitigation:
Align with OWASP Top Ten mitigation practice A01.
Use role-based or attribute-based access control (RBAC/ABAC)
Validate user permissions for every object accessed and never trust the client-side.

data.name:
Flask App / 

Web App
data.description: Python web application built using Flask.

threats.title: Generic Spoofing Threats
threats.description: Man-in-the-Middle (MitM)- Session cookies or login credentials are stolen by an attacker intercepting network traffic.
threats.mitigation:
Align with OWASP Top Ten mitigation practice A02.
Enforce HTTPS everywhere.
Use strong cipher suites

threats.title: Generic Tampering Threat
threats.description: Anti-clickjacking: An attacker manipulates a webpage parameter to redirect to another mimicked website and gain access to another user's data
threats.mitigation:
Align with OWASP Top Ten mitigation practice A04.
Restrict where content can be loaded from to prevent UI manipulation.
Use X-Frame-Options: DENY or Content-Security-Policy: frame-ancestors 'none'.

threats.title: Generic Information disclosure threat
threats.description: A generic Information disclosure threat whereby data is exposed: APIs return more data than intended, such as an entire User object when only the username is needed.
threats.mitigation:
Align with OWASP Top Ten mitigation practice A04.
Define and enforce a strict response schema
Enforce field-level and object-level access restrictions.
Use DTOs (Data Transfer Objects) or serializers to control output.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: Data exposure- APIs return more data than intended, such as an entire User object when only the username is needed.
threats.mitigation:
Align with OWASP Top Ten mitigation practice A04.
Define and enforce a strict response schema
Enforce field-level and object-level access restrictions.
Use DTOs (Data Transfer Objects) or serializers to control output.

diagrams.description: The Flask blog system consists of a User Interface, APIs, Login Sessions, and a Database, connected by trust boundaries between the client, web server, and data storage.
